snippet: As benchmark crude fell by nearly 8 percent, ConocoPhillips said it was cutting its global work force by 10 percent, or 1,800 jobs.
abstract: Price of crude oil falls back 8 percent after three days of high prices, same time as ConocoPhillips says it will cut its work force globally by 10 percent; while events are unrelated, they combine to confirm widespread feeling in industry that it is in decline.
lead_paragraph: As benchmark crude fell by nearly 8 percent, ConocoPhillips said it was cutting its global work force by 10 percent, or 1,800 jobs.

headline.main: Price of Crude Oil Tumbles After Soaring for 3 Days
headline.print_headline: Oil Tumbles After Spiking for 3 Days

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries
